campaign_variables.description: The maximum number of agents that can be assigned to research one technology.
(IN GAME) Multiplier applied to player annexed_territory diplomatic factor after realm divide has occured.
Chance of capturing an artillery unit from the losing side after a battle (percent 0-100)
(IN GAME) Window, in seconds, during which all shells will arrive
(IN GAME) Window, in seconds, during which all shells will arrive (max)
(IN GAME) Artillery support cooldown between uses (seconds)
(IN GAME) Minimum artillery support cooldown between uses (seconds)
(IN GAME) Artillery support damage per shell (DEFUNCT - projectile type-dependent)
(IN GAME) Maximum rtillery support damage per shell (DEFUNCT - projectile type-dependent)
(IN GAME) Artillery support time for artillery shells to arrive (seconds)
(IN GAME) Minimum artillery support time for artillery shells to arrive (seconds)
(IN GAME) Artillery support impact radius (metres)
(IN GAME) Minimum artillery support impact radius (metres)
(IN GAME) Artillery support number of shells per use
(IN GAME) Maximum artillery support number of shells per use
(IN GAME) Artillery support number of uses
(IN GAME) Maximum artillery support number of uses
(IN GAME) The advantage an alliance must have over the enemy, to wipe out the opposition on a win in the autoresolver
The chance of losing units receiving additional casualty by chase down
Maximum variation for performance in an alliance. Units will have performance between (1 – alliance_max_performance) and (1 + alliance_max_performance)
Minimum variation for performance in an alliance.. Units will have performance between (1 – alliance_min_performance) and (1 + alliance_min_performance)
The range of Gaussian random numbers for alliance performance
The standard deviation to be used when calculating Gaussian random numbers for alliance performance
The additional performance given to each unit per star level
A losing alliance will be wiped out when the win percentage is below this threshold
(IN GAME) The base proportion of losing navy kills that should be converted to captures (may choose to not capture these depending on the random factor applied later)

(IN GAME) This is a modifier applied to when calculating whether to take captives or not for a particular unit. Depending on the units base morale this is either added or deducted from the chance to take captives
Base ratio of captives to take in the range 0.0 -> 1.0. This is then modified. Keep to a low number.

This is a modifier that's randomised and then added or subtracted from the base ratio. So If you have a base ratio of 0.1 (10%) and a modifier of 0.75 (75%) you will have a base ratio between 0.025 and 0.175.
(IN GAME) A modifier for artillery missile combat in the autoresolver. Does not effect the gatling gun in any way. Boshin only.
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for artillery support
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for coastal defences
(IN GAME) A modifier for gatling gun missile combat in the autoresolver. Boshin only.
(IN GAME) A multiplier for boshin land unit missile potential in the autoresolver
(IN GAME) A multiplier for boshin land unit missile potential in the autoresolver. This is applied to the defender units in a siege battle.
(IN GAME) The number of ranged turns each naval unit gets in boshin battles. Used for balancing ranged and boarding damage.
(IN GAME) Maximum total potential allowed for a land unit in Boshin. Total potential is melee + missile. Values above this max will be scaled down to fit within this bound.
(IN GAME) Multiply the vs crew combat potential for naval units in boshin battles. Used for balancing crew and hull damage in ranged combat.
(IN GAME) Multiply the vs hull combat potential for naval units in boshin battles. Used for balancing crew and hull damage in ranged combat.
(IN GAME) Multiply the total combat potential for naval units in boshin battles. Used for balancing ranged and boarding damage.
(IN GAME) The chance we will not take a ship from the set of possible ships to capture
(IN GAME) Base chance ( 0.0 -> 1.0 ) of taking captives. Modified by generals, being out numbered etc...
(IN GAME) The effect an advantage in the generals star rating has on the win chances, effects the overall win chance
(IN GAME) The amount to increase AI casualties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is easy
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) human units recieve when the battle is austoresolved on battle difficulty easy
(IN GAME) Represents a positive/negative range for Gaussian random numbers - number will never be out of this range
(IN GAME) The standard deviation to be used when calculating Gaussian random numbers
(IN GAME) The amount to decrease AI casulaties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is hard
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) AI units recieve when the battle is autoresolved on battle difficulty hard
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement/impedance (winner/loser respectively) on a major victory
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a major loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a major victory
(IN GAME) The percentage of the win chances that should always be calculated by the unit combat potential alone.
(IN GAME) The minimum casualties percentage for a unit on an alliances lose
(IN GAME) The minimum casualties percentage for a unit on an alliances win (altered for class and relative strengths)
(IN GAME) The minimum win chance of an alliance, if their win chance is less than this they cannot win the autoresolve battle.
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement/impedance (loser/winner respectively) on a minor victory
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a minor loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a minor victory
Chance to capture a ship
When chasing down ships for capture. This is the chasing ships speed modification.
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage impedance for naval loser on a normal loss
(IN GAME) The casualty percentage improvement for naval winner on a normal victory
(IN GAME) The randomness to apply to the amount of captives % of base captives - keep it low
(IN GAME) The percentage of damage to keep on a ship that has been reassigned from sunk to captured
(IN GAME) Randomness of each ships damage, to represent vageries of battle - keep it low
(IN GAME) The percent damage required for a ship unit to sink
(IN GAME) Chance of massacre, compared to a normal win
Combat potential multiplier for units with an ambush bonus
Units will have a maximum rout strength of this value
Melee combat potential multiplier for hero units
Missile combat potential multiplier for hero units
The maximum number of ranged hits a unit can perform
Missile damage modifier for ranged combat
The maximum causality reduction for winning ranged unit at maximum win chance
Modify the number of ranged hits a unit performs
(IN GAME) Randomness of each units losses, to represent vageries of battle - keep it low
Missile crew damage modifier in ranged combat
Missile hull damage modifier in ranged combat
Missile damage modifier for ranged combat
Ships will surrender when their crew reach this strength percentage
The range of Gaussian random numbers for alliance performance
The standard deviation to be used when calculating Gaussian random numbers for unit performance
Faction leader will have this casualty modifier after battle
Protected units will have this casualty modifier on lose
Protected units will have this casualty modifier on major win
Protected units will have this casualty modifier on win
Units will be wiped out if their percentage strength is below this threshold
(IN GAME) The amount the damage probability should be scaled by the win chance in a naval battle with an unlikely result
(IN GAME) The amount to decrease AI casulaties in autoresolved battles when campaign difficulty level is very hard
(IN GAME) The advantage (applied to combat potential) AI units recieve when the battle is austoresolved on battle difficulty very hard
(IN GAME) Number of resource units always available on the global market for each resource (to prevent division by zero).
(IN GAME) The base amount of TW required for a town to grow its wealth level. Formula: base_wealth_increase*power((total_wealth_increases+1),2)
(IN GAME) Pop growth percentage in every region regardless of farms. We might want to define this on a per-region basis?
(IN GAME) The base chance of hitting for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The base damage figure for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The increase in hit chance for each point in bombard ability for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The increase in hit chance for each experience level for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The increase in damage for each point in bombard ability for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The increase in damage for each experience level for bombardment by a naval unit on the campaign map.
(IN GAME) The amount of experience granted to a ship for a successful bombardment action.
(IN GAME) Base distance at which targets can be bombarded.
(IN GAME) When considering the importance of buildings for a specific context how much should value for money count versus raw priority (0.0, not a bit to 1.0, entirely)
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, easy difficulty, levels to apply at
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias,easy difficulty, rounds to apply for
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, hard difficulty, levels to apply at
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, hard difficulty, rounds to apply for
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, legendary difficulty, levels to apply at
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, legendary difficulty, rounds to apply for
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, normal difficulty, levels to apply at
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, normal difficulty, rounds to apply for
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, very hard difficulty, levels to apply at
(IN GAME) CAI Budgeting bias, very hard difficulty, rounds to apply for
(IN GAME) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to food producgin buildings
(IN GAME) The point below which a food penalty will be applied to a building option
(IN GAME) Bonus applied (per food point) for buildings that increae food up to the specified level
(IN GAME) Penalty applied (per food point) for buildings that use food beyond the specified level
(IN GAME) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (easy difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (easy difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (easy difficulty)
(IN GAME) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (hard difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (hardl difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (hard difficulty)
(IN GAME) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (normal difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (normal difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (normal difficulty)
(IN GAME) Above zero, allows AI to consider retreat versus another AI
(IN GAME) Below this number of defending units don't allow retreat (very hard difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can not retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (very hard difficulty)
(IN GAME) If defender can retreat to a settlement and defender/attacker strength ratio is below this number, retreat (very hard difficulty)
(Not in use) Integer only.The multiplier applied to a regions prestige if that region is a region the capturing faction must capture to fulfill its victory conditions
The quality value boost for a unit with accuracy upgrades.
The quality value boost for a unit with armour upgrades.
The quality value boost for a unit with charge upgrades.
The quality value boost for 1 unit of experience.
The quality value boost for a unit with morale upgrades.
The quality value boost for a unit with weapons upgrades.
(IN GAME) Base recruitment cost for characters
(IN GAME) Cost each command star adds to the cost of the character.
(IN GAME) Max distance for character recruitment (recruitment over this distance will result in a capped distance-cost modifier)
(IN GAME) The maximum size of the character recruitment pool
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool.
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new general to the character recruitment pool.
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME) Number of turns it takes to add a new admiral to the character recruitment pool. Activated by bonus value.
(IN GAME) Research points being contributed by character attributes are clamped to this value in any research slot
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted for acquiring a vassal clan.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted for detected assassination attempts.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted by becoming christian.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted by being christian.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted by a crushing defeat in which the daimyo is involved.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted for dishonouring alliances.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted by an army containing the daimyo capturing a faction's last region.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted by a heroic victory in which the daimyo is involved.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted for looting a city.
(IN GAME) The amount of daimyo honour granted for following through on a rejected diplomatic threat.
(IN GAME) The threshold round number for villages to start appearing
(IN GAME) The threshold round number for level 1 villages
(IN GAME) The threshold round number for level 2 villages
(IN GAME) The threshold round number for level 3 villages
(IN GAME) The chance of a village to change model, per round, after a new threshold has been reached
(IN GAME) The inital angle of bombardment cannons (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The maximum time between bombard cannons firing (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The height above terrain that a bombard impact will hit a character (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The height above terrain that a bombard impact will hit a garrison (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) Bombardment cannonball speed (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The distance between cannonballs on bombard impact (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) Chance for a coastal defence cannon to cause an impact effect on the target ship (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) Chance for a coastal defence cannon to cause a splash around the target ship (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The time it takes for coastal defence cannons to reload (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The maximum time in seconds between coastal defence building becoming active (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The maximum time in seconds a cannon can fire after it's defence building has become active (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The time in seconds between a cannon firing and a splash effect firing (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) Maximum distance from the centre of the target ship that a splash effect can fire (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) Minimum distance from the centre of the target ship that a splash effect can fire (campaign map display)
(IN GAME) The number of milliseconds to fade trade routes over.
(IN GAME) The scale of trade carts/ships for a trade route of maximum flow.
(IN GAME) The time in milliseconds between trade carts/ships for a trade route of maximum flow.
(IN GAME) The upper value limit for trade route display. Trade routes with values greater than this are displayed as if they had this value.
(IN GAME) The scale of trade carts/ships for a trade route of minimum flow.
(IN GAME) The time in milliseconds between trade carts/ships for a trade route of minimum flow.
(IN GAME) The lower value limit for trade route display. Trade routes with values less than this are displayed as if they had this value.
(IN GAME) The relative time taken for a trade ship to travel the same distance as a trade cart.
(IN GAME) The distance offset of the trader to the left of the route in units.
(IN GAME) The speed of trade carts in units/second.
(IN GAME) Background gdp value.
(IN GAME) Background gdp value for minor nations.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
Integer only. This maps the faction leaders management attribute to a value ( such as +1 / -1 etc... ). This is applied to the ministers management level for working out the minister effects.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for an absolute monarchy government type.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for a constitutional monarchy government type.
This is multiplied to the value for the faction_leader_management_level for a republic government type.
(IN GAME) The age at which family members can first be considered adults.
(IN GAME) The age at which family members will definitely be considered adults.
(IN GAME) The base chance of family members having a child.
(IN GAME) The base percentage chance of a male child being offered a wife from one of the clans retainer families.
(IN GAME) The chance each turn that a child of appropriate age will be considered adult.
(IN GAME) The maximum age of a daimyo created on faction emergence.
(IN GAME) The minimum age of a daimyo created on faction emergence.
(IN GAME) The maximum age of a daimyo's wife created on faction emergence.
(IN GAME) The age at which the fathers chance of having children starts to decrease.
(IN GAME) The percentage chance of any child being male.
(IN GAME) The maximum decrease in chance of family members having a child due to the husbands age.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of children per family unit.
(IN GAME) The minimum age for a family member to become a hostage.
(IN GAME) The maximum age for a retainer daimyo on creation.
(IN GAME) The minimum age for a retainer daimyos on creation.
(IN GAME) The maximum_age for wifes offered to male children from one of the clans retainer families.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds between a character dieing and their surviving spouse being eligable to remarry.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds that must pass after a child is born before the parents may have another child.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds that must pass after family members marry before they can have a child.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds that must pass after a male child refuses an offer of a wife from one of the clans retainer families before he may be offered another one.
(IN GAME) The number of turns at start of game before any non-adult family member can be considered adult.
(IN GAME) The age at which women cease to have children.
(IN GAME) The number of years between each increase of the chance of a male child being offered a wife from one of the clans retainer families.
(IN GAME) The percentage by which the chance of a male child being offered a wife from one of the clans retainer families increases over time.
(IN GAME) The global food surplus multiplied by this value is applied as a town wealth growth factor to all regions.
(IN GAME) Base chance per round that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance)
(IN GAME) Additional per round chance that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance)
(IN GAME) Whether the aggression ramp is enable. 0=no, 1=yes
(IN GAME) Player fame level at which the ramp ends and the maximum level of aggression will be applied.
(IN GAME) Player fame level beyond which the aggression ramp will start to apply
(IN GAME) The ending level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. Should be equal to or greater than the minimum level selected. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH.
(IN GAME) The starting level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH.
(IN GAME) Round at which the ramp should finish (and max level be used for aggression increases)
(IN GAME) Round beyond which the aggression ramp will start (beginning with the minimum aggression level)
(IN GAME) In Gempei targetting and diplomatic adjustments the number of regions a minor faction must own before being considered major.
(IN GAME) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the adjustment applied against the desire of a major clan to aid a minor clan ally when being attacked or attacking
(IN GAME) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the adjustment applied against the desire of a major clan allying with a minor clan
(IN GAME) In Gempei diplomatic adjustments the weighing multiplier applied for a major clan joining a war against a minor clan at the request of a minor clan
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Domination easy difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Domination hard/very hard/legendary difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Domination normal difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Long or MP easy difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Long or MP hard difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Long or MP normal difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Short easy difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Short hard/very hard/legendary difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Short normal difficulty gempei campaign)
(IN GAME) The base general/admiral action point bonus
(IN GAME) Cost of a promoted general
(IN GAME) Gentleman happiness effect in settlement is derived from attribute_level divided by this value (rounded up)
(IN GAME) Total negative effect from all non-allied gentlemen in a settlement is clamped to this.
(IN GAME) Total positive effect from all allied gentlemen in a settlement is clamped to this.
Happiness effect of revolution in a neighbouring faction (per faction).
Happiness effect of revolution of any faction in the same culture (per faction).
Upper (positive) happiness cap for war-related effects.
Lower (negative) unhappiness cap for war-related effects.
Per-turn drift towards 0 of war-related happiness effects.
Happiness effect of a major defeat.
Happiness effect of a major victory.
Happiness effect of taking a region from the enemy.
(IN GAME) The number of turns a hostage is held for.
(IN GAME) Additional cost for inciting revolt for Ikko Ikki monks
(IN GAME) As percentage of population
(IN GAME) The minimum pct of the losing units max soldiers a unit can have before it is destroyed
(IN GAME) Chance of defection for a general with a loyalty of 1
(IN GAME) Chance of defection for a general with a loyalty of 2
(IN GAME) The amount by which a generals loyalty increases when he is married to a family member.
(IN GAME) The amount by which the loyalty of a general increases when they lose an office shortly after being granted it.
(IN GAME) The amount by which the loyalty of a general without an office increases when a lower level general is granted an office.
(IN GAME) The amount by which a family members loyalty increases when they become the heir.
(IN GAME) The amount by which a family members loyalty increases when they are replaced as the heir.
(IN GAME) Maximum percentage of a unit that is lost to attrition every turn
(IN GAME) Maximum distance at which targets can be bombarded.
(IN GAME) The maximum possible amount of daimyo honour.
(IN GAME) The maximum possible amount of general loyalty.
(IN GAME) Maximum port bombardment radius
Levels of town wealth that exist in the game data.
0.0005 (IN GAME) Means X% of the minority will emigate
0.012 (IN GAME) Percentage of net unhappiness contributing to unhappiness related migration. NUP% * X% * pop = emigration.
(IN GAME) The minimum possible amount of daimyo honour.
(IN GAME) The minimum possible amount of general loyalty.
Minimum popluation for a region.
(IN GAME) Mimimum population that must be left after recruitment; so population must be at least this PLUS the recruitment population cost to enable recruitment.
(IN GAME) Modification to critical failure chance
(IN GAME) Modification to critical success chance
(IN GAME) The multiplier applied to the multiplayer cost of a unit when given an armour upgrade in multiplayer.
(IN GAME) The fixed cost added to a unit when given an armour upgrade in multiplayer.
(IN GAME) The multiplier applied to the multiplayer cost of a unit when given a weapon upgrade in multiplayer.
(IN GAME) The fixed cost added to a unit when given a weapon upgrade in multiplayer.
(IN GAME) Maximum crew damage recieved through naval attrition
(IN GAME) Minimum crew damage recieved through naval attrition
(IN GAME) Crew damage threshold, below at which ships are counted as sunk
(IN GAME) Maximum hull damage recieved through naval attrition
(IN GAME) Minimum hull damage recieved through naval attrition
(IN GAME) Hull damage threshold, above which ships are counted as sunk
(IN GAME) Pct per agent level action point bonus granted to armies
(IN GAME) The initial honour for a non-general daimyo.
(IN GAME) Passive spying calculation region bonus
(IN GAME) Maximum effect of happiness due to automated policing.
(IN GAME) Policing_pips (sum of both classes) * sqrt(population) * policing_automated_cost_per_pop
(IN GAME) Cap on happiness from garrisoned units.
(IN GAME) The percentage of population growth required to spawn a new town, relative to the population of the last spawning.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted for losing a famous battle.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted for winning a famous battle.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points required for the emperor to acknowledge you.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points required for your faction to be known throughout japan.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points required to trigger realm divide.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points required for you to be considered a threat to the shogunate.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of prestige points that can be gained from daimyo honour.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of prestige points that can be gained from famous battles.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of prestige points that can be gained from infrastructure.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region your protectorates own.
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Long campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Domination campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of prestige points granted per region you own. (Short campaign)
(IN GAME) The number of carriages per train for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The height of telegraph poles for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The distance between telegraph poles for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The acceleration of the train for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The deceleration of the train for Boshin railways. Must be negative.
(IN GAME) The height of the train for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The maximum speed of the train for Boshin railways
(IN GAME) The length of time a train will be stationary in it's destination station
(IN GAME) Number by which population is reduced for recruitment of a single unit
(IN GAME) The maximum distance from the edge of a zone of control a piece can be to reinforce. Clamped between 0.1 and 4.0
(IN GAME) The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level zero (unupgraded) roads.
(IN GAME) The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level one roads.
(IN GAME) The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level two roads.
(IN GAME) The action point cost to travel 1 unit distance on level three roads.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds you must hold kyoto for before being declared shogun.
(IN GAME) The number of rounds between a general being granted an office and it being taken away without it affecting his loyalty.
(IN GAME) Base amount loot the looting force get when looting a settlement
(IN GAME) The pct of region town wealth given to a player when looting a settlement (0.0 - 1.0). Player also gets 0.15 of this % of GDP
(IN GAME) Percentage of region town wealth wiped out after looting. 0.0-1.0. (e.g. 0.7 means region town wealth reduced by 70%.)
(IN GAME) Public order penalty when a settlement is looted.
(UNUSED). Number of turns the GDP reduction effect lasts for after looting a region
(IN GAME). Public order penalty when a settlement is looted after it has surrendered.
(IN GAME) State gift diplomatic effect = (gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_linear) + (gift_value * gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_quadratic / root(combined_gdp))
(IN GAME) State gift diplomatic effect = (gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_linear) + (gift_value * gift_value * state_gift_multiplier_quadratic / root(combined_gdp))
Bonus for state religion conversion
(IN GAME) The logarithm base for the formula used for calculating loss of tax income from having too many regions.
(IN GAME) A multiplier on the loss of tax income from having too many regions.
(DEPRECATED) The percentage reduction in tax for each region in a governorship beyond the tax_efficiency_regions_minimum.
(IN GAME) The minimum number of regions before tax efficiency penalties apply.
(IN GAME) The maximum number of regions for tax efficiency purposes.
(IN GAME). Integer only. The multipler applied to a technology's prestige if the discovering in faction is the first faction in its culture to discover that technology
(IN GAME) The maximum diplomatic comparison multiplier addition for deals involving threats.
(IN GAME) The minimum diplomatic comparison multiplier addition for deals involving threats.
(IN GAME) The diplomatic comparison multiplier for deals not involving threats.
(IN GAME) The maximum threat reputation.
(IN GAME) The minimum threat reputation.
(IN GAME) The amount by which the threat reputation is reduced every time an empty threat is made.
(IN GAME) Number of rounds you have to declare war after a rejected diplomatic threat before everyone considers your threat empty.
(IN GAME) The amount the average ally fame contributes to a coalition fame score.
(IN GAME) The base value for the threaten modifier.
(IN GAME) The base fame value for the threaten modifier.
(IN GAME) The maximum threaten modifier.
(IN GAME) The minimum threaten modifier.
(IN GAME). The amount town wealth is reduced when strikes, riots, ultimatums, letters of demand or rebellions are active in a region.
(IN GAME) The maximum proportion of a trade route which may be commerce raided, in thousandths.
(IN GAME) The proportion of this ships commerce raid value that the next commerce raiding ship downstream on this route will achieve.
(IN GAME) The constant factor by which a factions gdp is multiplied to produce the faction trade resource consumption.
(IN GAME) The strategic value in trade for luxury resources or any resource which is already available to a faction.
(IN GAME) The minimum absolute difference between the current and target prices of a trade resource for the price change to be considered large.
(IN GAME) The minimum absolute difference between the current and target prices of a trade resource for the price change to be considered small.
(IN GAME) The proportion of trade resource value each resource not traded on to other factions contributes to total income
(IN GAME) Length limit on an international trade route.
(IN GAME) How much land routes are preferred over sea routes (0.5 = sea routes twice as preferred).
(IN GAME) The proportion of the trade route value that gets accumulated each turn, "time factor".
(IN GAME) The proportion of the combined gdps of the two factions which contributes to the value of a trade route.
(UNUSED) Volume of resources a trade ship can export.
(IN GAME) The proportion of the value of a state gift obtained for a unilateral diplomatic gift of equivalent raw value.
(IN GAME) Integer only. The multipler applied to a unit's prestige if the recruiting in faction is the first faction in its culture to recruit a unit of that unit's class
(IN GAME) The minimum pct of the units max soldiers a unit can have before it is destroyed
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'superior' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'exceptional' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'superior' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'exceptional' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'superior' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'exceptional' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'superior' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'exceptional' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'superior' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Threshold for 'exceptional' stat bonus
(IN GAME) Additional radius of the zone of control for pieces garrisoned in settlements or forts. Clamped between 0.0 and 4.0
(IN GAME) Radius of the zone of control for land pieces. Clamped between 0.1 and 8.0
(IN GAME) Radius of the zone of control for naval pieces. Clamped between 0.1 and 15.0
